page.title: 01Bladon village
page.content: Bladon in Oxfordshire is on the edge of the cotswold country. To the east the land is flat and accommodates an airport which is used mainley for training. There are gentle wooded hills to the west on one of which is an ancient earthwork, the Round Castle. the village is best known as the resting place of Sir Winston Churchill, whose simple grave in the churchyard is visited by thousands of people every year. A main road twists through the village, passing houses both ancient and modern and an attreactive village pump. To the north is Blemlieim Park, and some of the villagers still work 'on the estate' for the Duke of Marlborough. South is the smaller village of Begbroke, which has a Norman church and an old manor house, now a roman catholic Priory. The villages are
